Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory644.jpg'}

{3: 'Despite discovering the path to the underground facility, Vanessa and Vera cannot guarantee that Bambinata will be there. Just to be safe, they are still checking every room on their way, searching for any sign of her.'}
{3: 'The sensation of loss overwhelms Vanessa once again.'}

{3: 'She cannot believe how quickly another "puppet" is missing after Teasell. She knows that Bambinata will not follow Teasell\'s path, but the anxiety that has built up inside her has reached a fever pitch.'}
{3: 'Open a door—search—close the door. The old doors creak as they are turned as if whispering to Vanessa the dream she does not want to revisit.'}
{3: 'Vanessa can remember a door that is louder than any door when it is closed.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory642.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Are you asleep, Rosie?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Perhaps Bambinata can sense how Vanessa is feeling. Perhaps she just notices how different Vanessa's breathing sounds tonight."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I can't hide anything from you now, can I?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Are you still bothered by what Father and Mother said?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: '...Do you think that a person can have no talent at all, Bambinata?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Is it because I didn't work hard enough every time?", 4: '2'}

{3: 'Vanessa failed the laboratory assistant selection by one place. Raymond had to use his status so that there "happened to be" an extra position. Furious, Petra made Vanessa study at home for a month to not embarrass herself again.'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: "Bambinata knows how much time and effort you've spent, Rosie.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Doesn't matter how much time I spend if I have no talent.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Remember ballet? You were just there waiting for me every time I practiced.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "You don't need to repeat the basics over and over again like a fool the way I did.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: "Don't you want to work in the laboratory, Rosie? Mother said that would keep you away from the difficult and dangerous work. Isn't that good?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I'm even less talented in this than I was in ballet.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vanessa finally turns around and smiles self-mockingly at Bambinata.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I would just be in people's way, being the talentless hack that I am. I can't help laughing at how funny I'd look, doing my best and still falling behind.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bambinata', 3: "That's not true. You just... haven't found what you like, Rosie.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3101_03.jpg'}
{3: 'Not wanting Vanessa to belittle herself, Bambinata quickly comes to her defense.'}
{3: 'According to what Vanessa once said, the reason she has not gotten what she wanted must be because she does not like it enough.'}

{3: "More than ever before, Bambinata traces the vulnerability in Vanessa's eyes, hoping to support her statement with her own earnest gaze. Perhaps she has tried too hard, so much so that it makes Vanessa chuckle."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "You're the only one who'd listen to me... Ha. To think that I fought like hell to keep you away from this house when I was young."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Bambinata... If I want to go and find something that I'm meant for, will you support me?"}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Bambinata will support you.'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Bambinata will support you no matter what you want to do, Rosie.'}
{3: 'No more words are needed between them.'}
{3: 'Vanessa hands Bambinata the headphone in her left ear. The music playing becomes two, echoing in two drastically different hearts.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory641.jpg'}
{3: 'A few days later.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: "What? You don't want to go to the lab?", 4: '1'}
{3: "Vanessa is not trying to avoid her parents' gazes. Unlike Bambinata, Vanessa does not look like the child she was anymore. She is at the age when she wants to act according to her will."}
{3: 'How can the young explorer step away from the predetermined destination if the old guides will not let go of the flag that shows the way?'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "That's not going to happen.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'Do you know how many people your father contacted for you, Vanessa? Any idea how many times I had to put on a smile and nod the last few days?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: 'Rosie, you...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: '...I told you to stop calling me that.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: "You aren't acting rationally right now, and you're breaking your parents' hearts. You need to know that the path we have laid for you is the correct one.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "But I can't give you what you want in return. I'm no genius, I hate the work, I can't get the results I want, and the efforts and time I'll spend are pointless—why shouldn't I do something I'm actually good at?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Don't you also want me to deliver exceptional results?", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: "You're no genius? You hate it? Who do you think you are? The world doesn't spin around you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "But I must have the right to explore the world myself, don't I?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Let's say you manage to find something you're good at and like all by yourself. What makes you think that you can keep doing it?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Petra stands up from the sofa, her lips slightly trembling.'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'Who do you think it is that made me give up my projects and my degrees?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "If I could continue my research with your father back then, what I'm studying now won't be how to keep in contact with all the other rich housewives.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "You've grown wings, and now you think you can fly, huh? Have you ever wondered whose feathers were plucked to build the warm nest you grew up in?", 4: '1'}
{3: "Petra's voice gets louder and louder, her discontent filling the whole living room, seemingly shaking everything in the space."}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: 'Rosie... Vanessa, listen. Stop making your mother angry.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: 'Are you just mad because we grounded you for a month?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: 'How about taking a break with Bambinata for three days before going back to work? How does that sound?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Raymond pulls Bambinata toward Vanessa, gesturing for her to talk her sister down. Bambinata holds Vanessa's hands gently, and Vanessa looks more determined than ever."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "So you're just hoping that I'll become another you, Mother? Just want to puppet me around so that I can achieve the dreams you gave up?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "You're a project lead, Father, so you can bark orders in the lab without asking about all the mindless details. But this isn't your lab. This is your home.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'How old do you think I am? Have you ever listened to what I have to say apart from the times I disrupted your "project development"?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Frankly, I have something funny I must ask... but I bet you've never thought about it—does either of you really love me?", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: '"Do you love me?" The question is deafening in its weight, but all Bambinata can hear is the quiver in Vanessa\'s voice.'}
{1: '1', 3: "As the most insignificant person in the room, Bambinata clutches Vanessa's hands tightly, hoping to send her whatever strength Bambinata can offer, little as it may be."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: "I don't love you? Why else would I sacrifice so much for you and this family? Oh my god, Vanessa. How could you even ask that?!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'I think... you only love the part of me you deem worthy of love.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'I think you two only find the valuable part lovable.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I've made up my mind. I'm leaving home and studying at the F.O.S. Military Command College. I want to find my worth, the way I'd define it.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Raymond', 3: 'A military school? You have no idea how dangerous it is...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "You're right. I've only read the descriptions from my terminal, but that doesn't mean I don't comprehend how dangerous my choice is.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'I want to see the world with my own eyes and decide what I should do myself.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: 'Are you done acting out, Vanessa?', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Petra', 3: 'Haha... See it with your own eyes? Decide yourself? You might not like to hear it, but a lab rat used in a military experiment understands the cruelty of war more than you. How are you going to decide anything?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Do you think acting against your parents' will make you a free adult?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Or has scrolling on your terminal made you realize you're meant for the military?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "You're not wrong. But I'm tired of feeling like a failing puppet under your control.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Raymond', 3: "How can you say that? This isn't control. We've carefully calculated and planned for your future.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Raymond', 3: "If you're genuinely hoping to contribute to the war effort, there are many paths a researcher can take, a lot of which are combat-related. With our history and resources, you can easily make something significant.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Raymond', 3: "By then, everyone will recognize your contribution and remember your name. They will truly understand you and this perfect, scientific cradle that develops you. Why don't you understand something so plainly obvious?", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "So I don't get to decide what I research even if I obey and play scientist now. After all, the only path to the throne is the one you've paved—all I'll be is a gem on the crown. Our family's name is the one who wears it.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Vanessa grabs Bambinata's hand and steps up."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Nevermind. I never expected you to truly understand what I'm saying, Father, Mother.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'I already signed the agreement on my terminal. Everything is ready. My first class at F.O.S. starts in four days.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'My suitcase is almost packed as well. The last thing you should know is that Bambinata has agreed to come with me, so please tell me how to maintain and replace her memory chip.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: 'Vanessa, how... disappointing you are.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "You're wasting away what you could be worth.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: "I can't allow it. Bambinata... Her project has hit a bottleneck right now. She can't go.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: "I don't agree with what you've done, and there is no chance I'll let you take away such an important research subject.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'An important research subject? Has Bambinata been anything but an experiment subject you keep at home to the two of you?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'How wonderful that she can also keep your daughter company while acting as a perfect, "well-behaved" role model.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: "We've always treated Bambinata and you fairly. We never gave her any less all these years.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'Has Vanessa gotten these ridiculous ideas into your head too, Bambinata?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Raymond', 3: "...Bambinata, I trust that you're still the good girl you were. You must know how hard your parents have worked on your experiment, right?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Raymond', 3: "How can you possibly think about leaving us and following Vanessa's foolhardy whims?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Bambinata isn't one of your lab rats who exist just for your experiments!", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'What does her <//SELF> think?'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'A question she has never confronted begins to surface within the body weaved by metal and composites.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryMovieFilm.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3101_01.jpg'}
{3: 'The enormous mirror from the ballet classroom appears again, and Bambinata stares at the short and strange figure reflected in it.'}
{3: 'Where does her <//SELF> exist? In the M.I.N.D.? Her metallic spine? Or... inside the memory chip?'}
{3: 'Bambinata carefully observes every part of the figure, trying to find her <//SELF> and the parts that house it.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0.8', 4: '0.8', 5: '0'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Do you like ballet, Bambinata?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Did she like it when she was only mimicking how the person she admired spun and danced?'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Bambinata... If I want to go and find something that I'm meant for, will you support me?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Was she supporting Rosie because she was used to following commands?'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "You can't remember a thing even after you made a pinky promise...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Does <//WANTING> to know what she has forgotten go against being a well-behaved daughter?'}
{3: '<//WANTING> to listen to the softer soul underneath the hardened shell—'}
{3: '<//WANTING> to stop every drop of tear from ever forming—'}
{3: '<//WANTING> to show her appreciation for all the hard work spent despite the lack of glowing results—'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiHuaping.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Kurono Researcher', 3: 'What should you do...? You should be a good girl and behave.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiHuaping.prefab'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryMovieFilm.prefab'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory641.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory641.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Standing in the eye of the storm, Bambinata is surrounded by three people who are all confidently expecting the answer they want from her.'}
{3: "And Bambinata's answer is—"}
{3: 'Silence.'}
{3: '—She has to behave, so the <//SELF> that goes against it is wrong.'}
{3: '<//WANTING> to do it does not make it right.'}
{3: 'Although she no longer dares to return the gaze of the eyes she has admired for many days and nights, silence is still the only and the closest answer Bambinata can give to a correct answer.'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Ha. See? No one would want to be with you with the way you're acting now.", 4: '3'}

{2: 'Raymond', 3: 'Bambinata has always been more well-behaved than you since you were little, Vanessa. She knows to consider how we feel and what we do. Have you learned nothing from her all these years?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Vanessa no longer responds. Quietly she looks at Bambinata, who does not look up, as if she was not the one fighting and arguing.'}
{3: "Vanessa gently lets go of her hand, and Bambinata's tiny palm slips away weightlessly. Even then, Babinata keeps her head lowered. Vanessa looks away, smiling mockingly."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Splendid. Frankly, I'm sick of having someone so annoying around me all the time.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'As for something that I want to keep around... Well, I just need to be powerful enough to take it by force.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "One day, I will make it so that no one disobeys me. I'll return then so you can take a good look at my actual worth.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'With that, Vanessa returns to her bedroom for her suitcase before heading for the main door.'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'Let her go!', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The automatic door is slammed shut violently. Bambinata lifts her hand instinctively, but she soon realizes that there is no one left to hold.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'Time gradually passes like a fair and silent ruler.'}
{3: 'In the days ahead, the decisive one will pay for her choices, and the cowardly one will keep sinking in her confusion.'}
{3: 'The only difference is that once time fills that tiny memory chip with its void, all Bambinata can follow is the phantom of a phantom.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory642.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory642.jpg'}
{3: 'Having completed the routine maintenance, Petra brings the reset Bambinata back to her bedroom to rest. Bambinata looks at the name outside the door and asks with uncertainty.'}
{3: "Unlike her previous amnesia, this reset has all the data of Vanessa in Bambinata's memory chip overwritten by new daily events."}
{3: "Petra has anticipated many uncomfortable inconveniences as Bambinata continues to live in Vanessa's bedroom. Still, she has not completely erased all the traces of Vanessa from the house."}
{3: '"I want to observe if Bambinata will have a unique feedback to the memory loss." That was the reason Petra gave.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: "Vanessa is your sister. She... is not a well-behaved person. She's no longer home.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bambinata', 3: 'Vanessa...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bambinata chews over this strange but somehow familiar name, feeling like something is eager to leap out of her M.I.N.D., but she has no way to connect to it.'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Go get some rest. Today's inspection took an extra 30 minutes, so you can rest for 2 hours. I'll wake you before your father returns.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Petra closes the door after saying that.'}

{3: 'A giant white bed sits inside the bedroom. Bambinata walks toward one side of the bed out of habit and lies down, doing her best not to cross an invisible line in the middle of the bed and occupy the space across.'}
{3: '...Why did she not sleep on the side closer to the door? That should have been the more obvious approach.'}
{3: 'Before entering rest mode, she can see this question appearing in the darkness after she closes her eyes.'}
{3: 'She searches for a reason for her action from her memory data to no avail.'}
{3: 'A curious and frightening feeling reverberates within Bambinata—she wants to find out why.'}
{3: 'Unprecedented courage drives her to sit up and deduce the shape of a phantom from the items in the room.'}
{3: 'Clothes, jewelry, perfume... Every object and every detail draw a clearer and clearer silhouette in her head, but she still has no clue about whose silhouette it is.'}
{3: 'This is not enough. What else—'}
{3: 'Her gaze turns to the bedside. Following an unexplainable "instinct," she lifts the duvet away—and finds a small drawer that is often overlooked.'}
{3: 'Apart from collectibles she does not understand, there is also a stack of folded paper inside.'}
{3: 'Bambinata turns to the only page with a drawing and finds a young dancing girl and an unknown small figure depicted on it.'}
{3: "Sunlight, silken curtains, music, and elegant movement... Some fragments of memories briefly surface in Bambinata's M.I.N.D. but disappear abruptly before she can lay her hands on them."}
{3: 'She must not forget.'}
{3: 'She does not want to forget.'}
{3: 'She has to grab ahold of the remaining silhouette at least...'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'Bambinata takes the pen from the drawer and tries her best to leave behind something before the phantom is forever gone.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory640.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory640.jpg'}
{3: 'A few years later.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Construct Soldier', 3: "Commandant, we've been standing here for 20 minutes...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Did I let you speak?', 4: '2'}
{3: "The Construct shuts his mouth and shakes his head, taking a step back from Vanessa's side submissively."}
{3: 'Vanessa puts the scratched keycard back into her pocket and knocks instead.'}

{3: "Petra's standardized smile freezes the moment she opens the door. Before the air between them turns suffocating, Vanessa gestures to the Construct behind her, and he hands her a terminal with a document on it."}

{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'This is a requisition order. According to the terms, the Construct Bambinata is required to return to the Task Force with us and act as a backup member of the elite squad Egret.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Petra's hand lets go of the doorknob, and she crosses her arms the way Vanessa remembers."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'You. Tell her the punishment for disobeying a military order.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The Construct soldier is about to speak when Petra interrupts her.'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'No one in our family has applied for Bambinata to enlist. You have no right to take her away.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'I applied for her.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Petra', 3: "Our Construct isn't a combat unit. She's only here to assist with our research. I'm sure the decision-makers in the army aren't foolish enough to recruit anyone without considering what they're capable of, right?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Don't you worry. The army is certainly capable of making sure that all soldiers are battle-ready.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "You know full well what Bambinata should be doing, Vanessa, and you're still trying to take her away from here?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I don't have to answer any of your questions except for the ones about the terms of the order.", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Petra', 3: "...I've wondered a few times how it'd be when you finally come home. Perhaps you'd be more mature and sensible, I thought, but I was expecting too much from you, wasn't I? That said, you never fail to disappoint.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Is the heartwarming reunion over? Noted and thank you, Ms. Petra. Can my new teammate go with us now?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'Doctor Raymond is performing routine maintenance on her at the moment. You have to wait if you want to take her away.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: 'The family members also need time to say farewell to each other.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Wait inside. I don't want my neighbors to think that something embarrassing has visited upon our family.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Petra turns for the staircase, leaving Vanessa and the half-opened door behind in the sun.'}
{3: 'Vanessa only leads the soldier behind her inside the house she has forsaken when Petra completely vanishes behind the stairs.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory641.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory641.jpg'}
{3: 'The sofa, the rug, the color of the lights—everything except for the smell of the air freshener is as Vanessa remembers.'}

{3: 'This seems to be the first time the Construct soldier enters the Residential District. He stands there nervously, unable to keep himself from gawking at all the decorations and furniture in the house.'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Wait here. Don't walk around.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Construct Soldier', 3: 'Yes, Commandant.', 4: '1'}

{3: 'Vanessa walks toward the room that once belonged to her, and her name is still adhered to the door with magnets. One of the magnets is missing, but that appears to be the only mark time has left behind.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory642.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Pushing open the door lightly, she is confronted by a familiar view—even the artificial plants are the same as they used to look.'}
{3: "Vanessa's fingertips gently glide past the large, comfortable bed, and she recalls how she struggled to sleep when she first went to college because of how hard the bed was."}
{3: 'Will Bambinata struggle too?'}
{3: 'Hmph. Constructs probably do not struggle over these kinds of things.'}
{3: 'Vanessa turns her gaze away from the snowy blankets and pulls open the "secret drawer" by the bed.'}
{3: 'A thin layer of dust has covered the interior of the drawer, surprisingly. It must have been a while since it was last opened.'}
{3: "Inside, she finds Bambinata's favorite hairpin in the past, the bowtie Vanessa did not like and gave Bambinata, some finger puppets, brushes, and a dozen of unfinished drawings."}
{3: 'Vanessa spreads out the stack of paper, and the first one is a drawing of a girl dancing ballet and a stick figure without any features.'}
{3: 'The second one is a girl busy doing maths exercises, and a stick figure without any features.'}
{3: 'The third one, the fourth one... Each drawing is a snapshot of their childhood, and each one has a blank, featureless figure in them.'}
{3: 'In the background where it is empty, Bambinata wrote down many incomplete phrases and disjointed words.'}
{3: 'sister'}
{3: '"black butterfly hairpin"'}
{3: '"Bambinata likes it?"'}
{3: '"don\'t cry"'}
{3: 'experiment'}
{3: 'remember'}
{3: "The rest are all Vanessa's name. The penmanship started coherent and fluid but became hesitant and stuttering over time. Most of them even spelled her name wrong."}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'When did she draw them...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vanessa tries to ignore them, but every line on these drawings is now branded in her mind.'}
{3: 'Hearing a commotion in the living room, she immediately puts the paper back into a stack. Hesitating briefly, Vanessa puts the drawings inside her pocket instead of the drawer.'}
{3: "Looking over the other items inside the drawer, Vanessa does not find other things that may help stabilize Bambinata's M.I.N.D., and she pushes it back inside."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory641.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Construct Soldier', 3: '...Commandant!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Construct Soldier', 3: 'Raymond... Doctor Raymond just dropped this Construct on me before going back upstairs...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Petra', 3: 'I recommend waiting for at least three hours before turning on the Construct.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Glancing at Petra's indifferent expression, Vanessa reaches for the back of Bambinata's head—as expected, the slot where the memory chip was is now empty."}

{2: 'Petra', 3: "You know full well that Doctor Raymond won't let his research results leak so easily. We can't disobey a military order, but it is within our right to keep our scientific work.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Don't push your luck, Vanessa. You knew this would happen, and you just wouldn't relent.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "If you would just emphasize our hard work for just a second, the time and energy I spent on you wouldn't have been in vain, nor the love your father and I gave Bambinata.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Put her in the car and get her to the Science Council right away.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Construct Soldier', 3: 'Roger!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vanessa stops and turns around, looking at her shouting mother.'}
{3: 'Petra still looks cold and indifferent. She takes a deep breath and swallows the bitter taste in her mouth.'}
{2: 'Petra', 3: "Go. Don't you ever come back!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: '...Sure, Mother.', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory16.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The frame upgrade has been successful. Bambinata is now combat-ready.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "And I'll keep the old parts we've replaced as agreed?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Alright.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'What about the memory chip?', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I can't replicate what you described without the original chip. I've analyzed the port and the circuit to redesign an external module to store memory data, which is theoretically more effective and stable than before.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "But I don't think they extracted the memory chip properly last time. Whatever data is left in her is jumbled and scarce, resulting in M.I.N.D. deviation symptoms during our first run.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "To avoid affecting combat situations, I've partitioned the module with a drive containing combat, team, and mission data... basic information that she can access seamlessly, even if her memory is lost or disrupted.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'You should verify if the data in there is accurate.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'This call sign... Did you put it there?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Vanessa points at one of the segments on the terminal that reads—"Rosie".'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Some entries were done automatically based on the remaining memory data in her. We're hoping that it will lower the chance her M.I.N.D. will deviate. That said, you're free to edit them on the terminal if necessary.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "...And her past memories can't be recovered, can they?", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'This is all I can do for now. My guess is that her symptoms could be the after-effects of "the experiment," but I cannot make a more concrete conclusion without its detailed data.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "The key to solving Bambinata's predicament is to figure out how the Inver-Device causes the conflict in her M.I.N.D. and how to respond to it.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'But all the current research on the Inver-Device is still in its exploratory stage. It is nearly impossible to find out the correct way to avoid or resolve her problem under the current conditions.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Perhaps when we have finally deciphered the secrets of the Inver-Device, we will be able to find the missing pieces that resolve her complications. But I'm quite certain that would be an impossible task for now.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The good news is that her "amnesia" isn\'t due to memory loss. The data entered her Deep M.I.N.D. and couldn\'t be retrieved. We also have many things we can\'t recall, but these memories still exist in the subconscious.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'In other words, if we can resolve this problem, she will be able to recall all her memories in theory.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'If you think this is the most appropriate way to handle her situation, so be it.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I don't care what happens later... I just need my Constructs to obey me, that's all.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Isn't that right, Bambinata?", 4: '2'}
